summary: Army Corps of Engineers received DOD and other funds to construct barriers on the southwest U.S. border. With tight time frames to award some of the DOD-funded construction contracts, the Corps: Awarded $4.3 billion in noncompetitive contracts. (Competition helps ensure the government gets a good price; noncompetitive contracts can be more expensive.) Awarded several contracts that started work before finalizing terms (like cost). We recommended...
title: Southwest Border: Schedule Considerations Drove Army Corps of Engineers' Approaches to Awarding Construction Contracts through 2020
